name: CONNECT Counselling Services
description: Provides counselling to Deaf and hard of hearing individuals (16+), and their families, who are living with mental health challenges. Services are free, confidential and provided in an accessible environment using ASL, LSQ, note-taking, real-time captioning and amplification devices as required.
With the number of COVID-19 cases increasing every day, psychologists offer insights on how to separate yourself from others, while still getting the social support you need.
name: Keeping your distance to stay safe

description: This vlog has been created in part as a response to these difficult times connected to the COVID-19 pandemic, but also to remind us all that we can all reach out and help others.
name: Helping Others During the COVID-19 Pandemic
Therapy for Black Girls
description: So often the stigma surrounding mental health issues and therapy prevents Black women from taking the step of seeing a therapist. This space was developed to present mental health topics in a way that feels more accessible and relevant. Find Black therapists around the world; join community; podcast
Supporting our community during the Covid-19 by providing free and pay-what-you-can offerings
name: Centre for Mindfulness Studies

description: The Vault is home to intimate stories by women — our deepest thoughts, our darkest secrets, and our untold experiences worth sharing. They are offering one free story with code "TAKECARE" at checkout.
name: Vault Zine
That Discomfort You’re Feeling Is Grief by Scott Berinato
description: Some of the HBR edit staff met virtually the other day — a screen full of faces in a scene becoming more common everywhere. We talked about the content we’re commissioning in this harrowing time of a pandemic and how we can help people. But we also talked about how we were feeling...
Affordable shorter term therapy; During COVID-19, some of the counsellors in their community of practice are offering low-cost single-sessions online, $60 for 60 minutes
name: Hard Feelings
Abstract Collage Creations
description: This class is a calming way for you to stay connected and creative during these challenging times. Something that you can do with kids if they are home from school or maybe just to take your mind off things.

name: #COVIDdisability: Disability-Related Resources for Families
description: CACL will be sharing disability-related resources related to the COVID-19 pandemic on this page, pulled together in one spot for families. When you find reliable information or practices that may help other families, share it! And to be sure we see it, use #COVIDdisability.
Collab between TIFF + Crave; a series from Crave’s selection of titles, accompanied by conversations with special guests via IG. Crave is also offering free 30-day trial for new users.
name: Stay-at-Home Cinema
New Creations Counseling Services
description: Offers online therapy for individuals and couples with sliding scale both remotely and in-person. Based in Fort Lauderdale, FL.

name: TalkSpace
description:
Offering special COVID-19 specific programs: 
-Free therapist-led Facebook support groups
-16-day anxiety relief program to reduce and manage fear
-Ongoing support from our network of licensed therapists
Get $65 off with code APPLY65; Plans start at $65/week
Access 2500+ online courses from 140 top institutions. Courses in various subjects such as humanities, math, computer science.
name: edX

description: These structured sessions provide focused treatment for mild to moderate symptoms of anxiety and depression. We work together to improve your daily functioning and build skills and resources to support resilience. $25 weekly sessions - online only
name: Focused counselling for anxiety/depression during COVID-19

description: US network of local crisis centers that provides free and confidential emotional support to people in suicidal crisis or emotional distress 24 hours a day, 7 days a week. 1-800-273-8255 (or chat on website). Also available in Español, and for Deaf & Head of Hearing.
name: National Suicide Prevention Lifeline
Matt Eldridge Counselling
description: During the COVD-19 Pandemic, is offering some sliding scale appointments. All appointments are currently being offered online/by telephone. Incorporates skills and strategies from Dialectical Behaviour Therapy, Cognitive Behavioural Therapy, and Mindfulness.
A free therapist-led online drop-in group, at 2pm each Thursday in April. A safe space to share, be heard, and find new ways of supporting yourself to 'ride the waves' during the COVID-19 pandemic
name: Anxious Times Support: A Drop-in Online Support Group
Facing COVID-19 With Community Instead of Fear
description: Inspirational article on how others are creating community for those in need.
Tip sheet for caregivers for their mental health during COVID-19
name: Caregiver Mental Health During COVID-19 Outbreak

description: An article that compiles 12 museums around the world that offer virtual tours and events through their website so you can still "travel" around the world, at home.
name: These 12 Famous Museums Offer Virtual Tours

description: As the government announces further social distancing measures, how should people maintain good mental health in long periods of self-isolation?
name: Coronavirus: Manaing mental health during social-isolation
Mental Health Pandemic (Facebook Group)
description: Facebook group to share resources and information to help deal with our mental health during this time.

name: Mind Control: Managing Your Mental Health During COVID-19
description: The intent of this course is to give you a deeper understanding of the anxiety reaction as it relates to various aspects of our current life, ranging from our consumption of news to the way we talk to our children about this.

name: Checking-in to prevent checking-out
description: If you are working with other people to build a movement for social justice and liberation, then you probably find yourself in meetings, what, every once in a while?

name: Scribe Book School - Book Writing Course
description: Scribe Book School reveals the exact, step-by-step process used with their authors that pay $5k or more to help them write, publish and market their books.

name: Anishnawbe Health Toronto (AHT)
description: Improving health and well being of Aboriginal People in spirit, mind, emotion and body through Traditional and Western healing approaches. Programs and services offered are based on culture and traditions through a multi-disciplinary team of dedicated healthcare professionals and service providers.

name: Toronto Distress Centre
description:
GTA: 416-408-4357 (HELP) / PEEL: 905-459-7777.  
Provides telephone support to individuals in the community who are at risk and their most vulnerable. Highly-trained volunteer responders (with the support of professional staff) connect with callers 24 hours a day, 7 days a week, 365 days a year.

name: COVID19 Therapists for Frontline Workers
description: They facilitate pro bono mental health services for healthcare workers who have been impacted by COVID-19 (i.e., doctors, nurses, nursing aides, paramedics, PSWs, etc).

name: Bereaved Families of Ontario - Toronto (BFO-Toronto)
description: A local charitable organization for people who are grieving the death of a loved one. Offering 1-1 phone or video calls, peer-led group supports, and also announcing new meetings and activities. Phone or email programsupport@bfotoronto.ca or 416-440-0290x102. All services free.
In-person and online options. Sliding scale options. Free initial consult call.
name: Shift Collab
AGO from Home
description: On March 27 we launched AGO from Home, a new way to enjoy the museum from your home, bringing you into the building virtually through unique access to stories and experiences. AGO from Home will give everyone a chance to engage with art and our team at the AGO through interesting and diverse stories, videos, and closer looks at artwork as well as some DIY and How-To videos.

name: Real Campus
description: If you are a University or College student at eligible campuses you have access to free therapy sessions. Visit the website for eligibility here.

name: Bored Solutions
description: A fun little site of various activities/challenges you can take if you're feeling bored or want to get your mind off things.

name: Transitioning to remote & organizing with physical distance
description: These two free sessions will provide guidance, an opportunity for sharing and discussion, and access to a Slack community of organizers for follow-up and resource-sharing.

Practice anywhere. Practice everywhere. All-level classes led by our global yoga ambassadors.
Includes Power yoga; Restorative Yoga, Vinyasa Yoga, Yoga for Runners; Yoga for Every Level
name: Yoga Videos by Lululemon
Stop Trying to Be Productive
description: The internet wants you to believe you aren’t doing enough with all that “extra time” you have now. But staying inside and attending to basic needs is plenty.

In this course you will engage in a series of challenges designed to increase your own happiness and build more productive habits. Professor Santos reveals misconceptions about happiness, annoying features of the mind that lead us to think the way we do, and the research that can help us change.
name: The Science of Well-Being

description: A toolkit of resources for anxiety and your mental health in a global climate of uncertainty.

description: I see you. I really do. You are vigorously scouring your social feeds looking for the newest articles on the coronavirus and COVID-19 while simultaneously ordering overly expensive hand sanitizer on Amazon...
name: Managing the COVID-19 Pandemic Panic

name: Tolerance for Uncertainty: A COVID-19 Workbook
description: A guide to accept your feelings, tolerate distress, and thrive. This workbook was created to assist you with managing the strong emotions that will arise during this difficult time through a form of psychological treatment called Dialectical Behaviour Therapy (DBT).

description:
Covers: Practical advice for staying at home; Taking care of your mental health and wellbeing; Support for work, benefits and housing; Checklist for staying at home.
In English or Welsh.

description: Rachelle Bensoussan is a bereavement clinician/grief therapist for 12 years and offering 1:1 support via Zoom and hosting online grief writing workshops and online group grief literacy trainings

Dive into breathing techniques that are approved by ancient traditions, by modern science. Use the power of breathing and meditation to increase your mindfulness and live a better life. You will see the positive impact anyway, for only 7-15 minutes a day.
name: Prana Breath: Calm & Meditate
The Liminal Library
description: Watch all of our 50+ special virtual well-being workshops on topics like self-hypnosis, intuitive business, Human Design, astrology, nutrition, and more before they disappear on May 31st, 2020.

Coronavirus has plunged the world into uncertainty and the constant news about the pandemic can feel relentless. All of this is taking its toll on people's mental health, particularly those already living with conditions like anxiety and OCD. So how can we protect our mental health?
name: Coronavirus: How to protect your mental health
Umbrella Mental Health Network
description: A network of queer and trans-identified mental health professionals who work primarily in the lesbian, gay, bisexual, trans, queer, intersex, asexual, two-spirited (LGBTQIA2S) community within Toronto.

name: Improving Mental Health During COVID-19
description: A comprehensive guide of information and resources for improving mental health through COVID-19

A free digital program for all Canadians – to support your mental well-being through the COVID-19 crisis. Get guidance that’s created to help with the specific emotional well-being concerns stirred by the pandemic, through easy-to-digest resources from our team of caring clinical psychologists.
name: Stronger Minds by BEACON
Seniors Safety Line
description: Provides contact and referral information for local agencies across the province that assist in cases of elder abuse. Trained counsellors also provide safety planning and supportive counseling for older adults who are being abused or at-risk of abuse. Call 1-866-299-1011 from anywhere in Ontario.

name: If You Have Anxiety and Depression but Feel Better...

Online COVID-19 Support Group
description: Small, facilitated online group (max of 8 people) will meet for 90 minutes each week for six weeks. It is specifically designed for folks who are at-risk of life-threatening complications if they contract COVID-19 or other infections like influenza. $150/6 weeks

name: Peloton Workout App

description: Offers immediate counselling and crisis intervention to all Indigenous peoples across Canada. be there

Healthcare workers also get free access until July 1st.

description: Special pay-what-you-can online clinic with no minimum fee for folks who are feeling the wear of social isolation and struggling to access mental health services due to lack of funds. All sessions will occur online with voice or voice & video conferencing. No consult required.
name: Online COVID-19 Respite Clinic
211 Ontario - COVID-19
description:
211 Ontario is your primary source of information on government and community-based social services. Includes mental health services/programs. Call 2-1-1, 24 hours, 7 days a week in 150 languages. 
Website also has chat and search feature.

name: Affinity Creative Suite Software
description: To provide some support during this incredibly difficult time, we’re now offering a 90-day free trial of all the Mac and Windows versions of the whole Affinity suite. We’re also offering a 50% discount for users who would prefer to buy and keep the apps, including iPad versions.

name: Liberate Meditation app

name: D&I Learning Platform

description: Since library branches are closed, and we're all staying home as much as we can, we want to make sure that you're stocked up with things to read, watch, listen to, learn and do. Here's a quick guide to all of the online services you can use with your library card.
name: 38 Ways to Use the Library from Home

description: We’re the first social and wellness platform designed to celebrate people of color. In addition to our online oasis, we have a members clubhouse located in East Williamsburg, Brooklyn.

InsightTimer: Largest Free Library of Guided Meditations
description: We believe everyone deserves access to a free daily meditation practice. Which is why we publish the world's largest collection of free guided meditations, with over 40,000 titles.

Although we’re all facing uncertainty, health care professionals on the frontline are bearing the brunt of this devastating pandemic That’s why Talkspace and our partners are providing 2,100 free months of therapy for doctors, nurses, social workers and front line workers.
name: TalkSpace
Nike Training Club
description: Turn staying in into your at-home advantage. Start training with a personal plan that guides you—while adjusting to your progress, schedule and other activities. With NTC, you get access to four 4–6 week training plans.

Some of Shifu Yan Xin (34th generation Shaolin Disciple) asked him about what training we can do to keep our lungs strong and healthy, so Shifu has made this video, where he has designed 5 Shaolin Qi Gong movements that will help us to work on our lungs and strengthen it. 9:19 minutes (Youtube)
name: 5 Shaolin Qi Gong Breath Exercises to Strengthen the Lungs

description:
Text HOME to 741741 to connect with a Crisis Counselor (Canada/US)
Free 24/7 support at your fingertips
A live, trained Crisis Counselor receives the text and responds, all from our secure online platform. The volunteer Crisis Counselor will help you move from a hot moment to a cool moment.
name: Crisis Text Line

description: Many teams around the world are making a quick transition to remote work right now...we’ve been honing what works–and what doesn’t–for nine years of being a virtual workplace. At the core of feeling good as individuals and as a team, and at the core of doing good work, is trust..
name: Building Trust While Working Remotely

description: Flying Books is a bookshop nestled inside three different businesses in downtown Toronto. Rotating selections include fiction, memoirs, graphic novels, science, or history – always choosily chosen. Free, contactless delivery within Toronto only until April 30 with promo code AIRDROP.

description: A comprehensive guide for all things mental health from stress and anxiety, quarantine and isolation, and stigma and prejudice. Also resources for healthcare workers.

description: Canada's only 24/7 national support service. Text, Phone, Live Chat and Other resources for kids and youth. 1-800-668-6868 to talk to a counsellor privately, no judgement, and confidential. English and French.

name: Care-based Approaches to Remote Work
Yzobela Hyett
description: Offering individual online/phone therapy, and is able to offer sliding scale to individuals who are financially impacted by Covid-19

I have immediate availability for virtual sessions- whether short term for support during our time of crisis or interest in long term support as we rise to the other side of this time of isolation. At this time of economic instability I am offering ‘pay-what-you-can’ or deferred payment to those who are facing financial uncertainty.

name: Open Path Psychotherapy Collective
description: Our therapists provide affordable, in-office and online psychotherapy sessions between $30 and $60 (between $30 and $80 for couples & family sessions)

Human beings like certainty.  We are hard-wired to want to know what is happening when and to notice things that feel threatening to us.  When things feel uncertain or when we don’t generally feel safe, it’s normal to feel stressed...
name: Taking Care of Your Mental Health in the Face of Uncertainty

description: With guidance from Dr. Keith Dobson, clinical psychologist and professor at the University of Calgary, the Mental Health Commission of Canada has compiled the following tips to help Canadians protect their mental health as they strive to safeguard their physical well-being...
name: Choosing sources of COVID-19 info carefully is critical

description: We offer support to anyone concerned about suicide. Whether you are suffering from a loss, worried about someone who may be having suicidal thoughts, or having suicidal thoughts yourself, our highly trained responders are there to provide support. Call toll-free number 1-833-456-4566
name: Crisis Services Canada
